title: (x) Surrender must cry live have paint be - Times New Roman {Yves}
content:
Also this other font, after WhatTheFont and several tries at Identifont, I still couldn’t get to an accurate id for this one, anyone who could please help?

My first thought had been Times New Roman, yet I wasn’t too sure as I couldn’t quite find a version/weight to match the original... Now also at WhatTheFont again I was pointed to Times New Roman, though having been replied there that it “looks condensed by hand rather than original condensed design (serifs are deformed)”.

Thus again I’d truly appreciate also your views over it please and thank you so much already for any further enlightenment.

(And yet I’m sorry that some of the letters in the image provided are not as legible, but unfortunately I couldn’t make a better scan of them... :/)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005028im_/http:/typophile.com/files/surrender_6168.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Ferrell International logo - ITC Serif Gothic {Yves, Patrick Broderick}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005028/http:/typophile.com/node/19678 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) 3D3 stright angled script - similar to FIG Script, Gretel {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005028/http:/typophile.com/node/19661 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sweepi

comments.content:
I know that there’s at least one Chinese font with a squooshed TNR in the latin codepage.

- Lex
Thank you for the additional enlightenment. :)
